rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CV.CVTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in CVTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in CVTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). CVTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.
datasetVariables.label: Short Name of Cardiovascular Test
datasetVariables.name: CVTESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CV.CVSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from CVORRES in a standard format or in standard units. CVSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in CVSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in CVORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in CVSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: CVSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CV.CVSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from CVSTRESC. CVSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: CVSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CV.CVSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized units used for CVSTRESC and CVSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: CVSTRESU

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CV.CVSTAT

datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: CVSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

datasetVariables.name: CVREASND

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CV.CVTPT

datasetVariables.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See CVTPTNUM and CVTPTREF.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CV.CVELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (CVTPTREF) such as "PREVIOUS DOSE" or "PREVIOUS MEAL". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: CVELTM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable CV.CVTPTREF

datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: CVTPTREF

datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: CVRFTDTC

description: A findings domain that contains physiological and morphological findings related to the cardiovascular system, including the heart, blood vessels and lymphatic vessels. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102605, 2018-06-29)
label: Cardiovascular System Findings
name: CV
